Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a coarse red-pottery vessel, interior slightly grooved, exterior covered with a light-brown slip and with remains of one lines of black-painted hieratic text identifying contents.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amarna, el-, TA:21-22/144 Workmen's Village
Curator's comments: Peet & Woolley, City of Akhenaten I:164 pl.LXIII, fig.A
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393127) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393127)
Associated places: Named in inscription: Domain of Aten
